CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function uses the `innerHTML` property to insert user-controlled data (`html`) into the HTML document. If an attacker can control the `html` variable, they can inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the web page, which will be executed when the page is loaded. This can lead to a variety of attacks, such as stealing sensitive information or performing actions on behalf of the user.
